 31 /*global JXG: true, define: true*/
 32 /*jslint nomen: true, plusplus: true*/
 33 
 34 /* depends:

 44 /**
 45  * @fileoverview This file contains the Math.Clip namespace for clipping and computing boolean operations
 46  * on polygons and curves
 47  *
 48  * // TODO:
 49  * * Check if input polygons are closed. If not, handle this case.
 50  */
 51 
 52 define([
 53     'jxg', 'base/constants', 'base/coords', 'math/math', 'math/geometry', 'utils/type', 'utils/expect'
 54 ], function (JXG, Const, Coords, Mat, Geometry, Type, Expect) {
 55 
 56     "use strict";
 57 
 58     /**
 59      * Math.Clip namespace definition. This namespace contains algorithms for Boolean operations on paths, i.e.
 60      * intersection, union and difference of paths. Base is the Greiner-Hormann algorithm.
 61      * @name JXG.Math.Clip
 62      * @exports Mat.Clip as JXG.Math.Clip
 63      * @namespace
 64      */
 65     Mat.Clip = {
 66 
 67         /**
 68          * Add pointers to an array S such that it is a circular doubly-linked list.
 69          *
 70          * @private
 71          * @param  {Array} S Array
 72          * @return {Array} return the array S
 73          */
 74         doublyLinkedList: function(S) {
 75             var i,
 76                 le = S.length;
 77 
 78             if (le > 0) {
 79                 for (i = 0; i < le; i++) {
 80                     S[i]._next = S[(i + 1) % le];
 81                     S[i]._prev = S[(le + i - 1) % le];
 82                 }
 83                 S[le - 1]._end = true;
 84             }
 85 
 86             return S;
 87         },
 88 
 89         /**
 90          * Determinant of three points in the Euclidean plane.
 91          * Zero, if the points are collinear. Used to determine of a point q is left or
 92          * right to a segment defined by points p1 and p2.
 93          * @private
 94          * @param  {Array} p1 Coordinates of the first point of the segment. Array of length 3. First coordinate is equal to 1.
 95          * @param  {Array} p2 Coordinates of the second point of the segment. Array of length 3. First coordinate is equal to 1.
 96          * @param  {Array} q Coordinates of the point. Array of length 3. First coordinate is equal to 1.
 97          * @return {Number} Signed area of the triangle formed by these three points.
 98          */
 99         det: function(p1, p2, q) {
100             return (p1[1] - q[1]) * (p2[2] - q[2]) - (p2[1] - q[1]) * (p1[2] - q[2]);
101         },
102 
103         /**
104          * Winding number of a point in respect to a polygon path.
105          *
106          * The point is regarded outside if the winding number is zero,
107          * inside otherwise. The algorithm tries to find degenerate cases, i.e.
108          * if the point is on the path. This is regarded as "outside".
109          * If the point is a vertex of the path, it is regarded as "inside".
110          *
111          * Implementation of algorithm 7 from "The point in polygon problem for
112          * arbitrary polygons" by Kai Hormann and Alexander Agathos, Computational Geometry,
113          * Volume 20, Issue 3, November 2001, Pages 131-144.
114          *
115          * @param  {Array} usrCoords Homogenous coordinates of the point
116          * @param  {Array} path      Array of JXG.Coords determining a path, i.e. the vertices of the polygon.
117          * @return {Number}          Winding number of the point. The point is
118          *                           regarded outside if the winding number is zero,
119          *                           inside otherwise.
120          */
121         windingNumber: function(usrCoords, path) {
122             var wn = 0,
123                 le = path.length,
124                 x = usrCoords[1],
125                 y = usrCoords[2],
126                 p1, p2, d, sign, i;
127 
128             if (le == 0) {
129                 return 0;
130             }
131 
132             // Infinite points are declared outside
133             if (isNaN(x) || isNaN(y)) {
134                 return 1;
135             }
136 
137             // Handle the case if the point is a vertex of the path
138             if (path[0].usrCoords[1] === x &&
139                 path[0].usrCoords[2] === y) {
140 
141                 // console.log('<<<<<<< Vertex 1');
142                 return 1;
143             }
144 
145             for (i = 0; i < le - 1; i++) {
146                 // Consider the edge from p1 = path[i] to p2 = path[i+1]
147                 p1 = path[i].usrCoords;
148                 p2 = path[(i + 1) % le].usrCoords;
149                 if (p1[0] === 0 || p2[0] === 0 ||
150                     isNaN(p1[1]) || isNaN(p2[1]) ||
151                     isNaN(p1[2]) || isNaN(p2[2])) {
152 
153                     continue;
154                 }
155 
156                 if (p2[2] === y) {
157                     if (p2[1] === x) {
158                         // console.log('<<<<<<< Vertex 2');
159                         return 1;
160                     } else {
161                         if (p1[2] === y && ((p2[1] > x) === (p1[1] < x))) {
162                             // console.log('<<<<<<< Edge 1', p1, p2, [x, y]);
163                             return 0;
164                         }
165                     }
166                 }
167 
168                 if ((p1[2] < y) !== (p2[2] < y)) {
169                     sign = 2 * ((p2[2] > p1[2]) ? 1 : 0) - 1;
170                     if (p1[1] >= x) {
171                         if (p2[1] > x) {
172                             wn += sign;
173                         } else {
174                             d = this.det(p1, p2, usrCoords);
175                             if (d === 0) {
176                                 // console.log('<<<<<<< Edge 2');
177                                 return 0;
178                             }
179                             if ((d > 0) === (p2[2] > p1[2])) {
180                                 wn += sign;
181                             }
182                         }
183                     } else {
184                         if (p2[1] > x) {
185                             d = this.det(p1, p2, usrCoords);
186                             if ((d > 0 + Mat.eps) === (p2[2] > p1[2])) {
187                                 wn += sign;
188                             }
189                         }
190                     }
191                 }
192             }
193 
194             return wn;
195         },
196 
197         /**
198          * JavaScript object containing the intersection of two paths. Every intersection point is on one path, but
199          * comes with a neighbour point having the same coordinates and being on the other path.
200          *
201          * The intersection point is inserted into the doubly linked list of the path.
202          *
203          * @private
204          * @param  {JXG.Coords} coords JSXGraph Coords object conatining the coordinates of the intersection
205          * @param  {Number} i        Number of the segment of the subject path (first path) containing the intersection.
206          * @param  {Number} alpha    The intersection is a p_1 + alpha*(p_2 - p_1), where p_1 and p_2 are the end points
207          *      of the i-th segment.
208          * @param  {Array} path      Pointer to the path containing the intersection point
209          * @param  {String} pathname Name of the path: 'S' or 'C'.
210          */
211         Vertex: function(coords, i, alpha, path, pathname) {
212             this.coords = coords;
213             this.usrCoords = this.coords.usrCoords;
214             this.scrCoords = this.coords.scrCoords;
215 
216             this.intersect = true;
217             this.alpha = alpha;
218             this.pos = i;
219             this.path = path;
220             this.pathname = pathname;
221             this.done = false;
222 
223             // Set after initialisation
224             this.neighbour = null;
225             this.entry_exit = false;
226             this.cnt = 0;
227         },
228 
229         /**
230          * Sort the intersection points into their path.
231          * @private
232          * @param  {Array} P_crossings Array of arrays. Each array contains the intersections of the path
233          *      with one segment of the other path.
234          * @return {Array}  Array of intersection points ordered by first occurrence in the path.
235          */
236         sortIntersections: function(P_crossings) {
237             var i, j, P, last,
238                 P_intersect = [],
239                 P_le = P_crossings.length;
240 
241             for (i = 0; i < P_le; i++) {
242                 P_crossings[i].sort(function(a, b) { return (a.alpha > b.alpha) ? 1 : -1; });
243                 if (P_crossings[i].length > 0) {
244                     last = P_crossings[i].length - 1;
245                     P = P_crossings[i][0];
246                     P._prev = P.path[P.pos];
247                     P._prev._next = P;
248                     for (j = 1; j <= last; j++) {
249                         P = P_crossings[i][j];
250                         P._prev = P_crossings[i][j - 1];
251                         P._prev._next = P;
252                     }
253                     P = P_crossings[i][last];
254                     P._next = P.path[P.pos + 1];
255                     P._next._prev = P;
256 
257                     P_intersect = P_intersect.concat(P_crossings[i]);
258                 }
259             }
260             return P_intersect;
261         },
262 
263         /**
264          * Find all intersections between two paths.
265          * @private
266          * @param  {Array} S     Subject path
267          * @param  {Array} C     Clip path
268          * @param  {JXG.Board} board JSXGraph board object. It is needed to convert between
269          * user coordinates and screen coordinates.
270          * @return {Array}  Array containing two arrays. The first array contains the intersection vertices
271          * of the subject path and the second array contains the intersection vertices of the clip path.
272          * @see JXG.Clip#Vertex
273          */
274         findIntersections: function(S, C, board) {
275             var res = [],
276                 i, j, k, l, ignore, min_S, min_C, max_S, max_C, swap, crds,
277                 P,
278                 S_le = S.length - 1,
279                 C_le = C.length - 1,
280                 // cnt = 0,
281                 IS, IC,
282                 S_intersect = [],
283                 C_intersect = [],
284                 S_crossings = [],
285                 C_crossings = [];
286 
287             for (j = 0; j < C_le; j++) {
288                 C_crossings.push([]);
289             }
290 
291             // Run through the subject path.
292             for (i = 0; i < S_le; i++) {
293                 S_crossings.push([]);
294 
295                 // Run through the clip path.
296                 for (j = 0; j < C_le; j++) {
297                     // Test if bounding boxes of the two curve segments overlap
298                     // If not, the expensive intersection test can be skipped.
299                     ignore = false;
300                     for (k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
301                         min_S = S[i].usrCoords[k];
302                         max_S = S[i + 1].usrCoords[k];
303                         if (min_S > max_S) {
304                             swap = max_S;
305                             max_S = min_S;
306                             min_S = swap;
307                         }
308                         min_C = C[j].usrCoords[k];
309                         max_C = C[j + 1].usrCoords[k];
310                         if (min_C > max_C) {
311                             swap = max_C;
312                             max_C = min_C;
313                             min_C = swap;
314                         }
315                         if (max_S < min_C || min_S > max_C) {
316                             ignore = true;
317                             break;
318                         }
319                     }
320                     if (ignore) {
321                         continue;
322                     }
323 
324                     // Intersection test
325                     res = Geometry.meetSegmentSegment(S[i].usrCoords, S[i + 1].usrCoords,
326                                                       C[j].usrCoords, C[j + 1].usrCoords);
327 
328                     // Found an intersection point
329                     if (res[1] >= 0.0 && res[1] <= 1.0 &&
330                         res[2] >= 0.0 && res[2] <= 1.0) {
331 
332                         crds = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, res[0], board);
333 
334                         IS = new this.Vertex(crds, i, res[1], S, 'S');
335                         IC = new this.Vertex(crds, j, res[2], C, 'C');
336                         IS.neighbour = IC;
337                         IC.neighbour = IS;
338 
339                         S_crossings[i].push(IS);
340                         C_crossings[j].push(IC);
341                     }
342                 }
343             }
344 
345             // For both paths, sort their intersection points
346             S_intersect = this.sortIntersections(S_crossings);
347             for (i = 0; i < S_intersect.length; i++) {
348                 S_intersect[i].cnt = i;
349                 S_intersect[i].neighbour.cnt = i;
350             }
351             C_intersect = this.sortIntersections(C_crossings);
352 
353             return [S_intersect, C_intersect];
354         },
355 
356         /**
357          * Mark the intersection vertices of path1 as entry points or as exit points
358          * in respect to path2.
359          *
360          * This is the simple algorithm as in
361          * Greiner, Günther; Kai Hormann (1998). "Efficient clipping of arbitrary polygons".
362          * ACM Transactions on Graphics. 17 (2): 71–83
363          *
364          * @private
365          * @param  {Array} path1 First path
366          * @param  {Array} path2 Second path
367          */
368         markEntryExit: function(path1, path2, first_point_type) {
369             var status,
370                 P = path1[0];
371 
372             // if (first_point_type === 'in') {
373             //     status = 'exit';
374             //     P.entry_exit = 'entry'; // For non-closed paths
375             // } else if (first_point_type === 'out') {
376             //     status = 'entry';
377             //     P.entry_exit = 'exit';  // For non-closed paths
378             // } else {
379                 if (this.windingNumber(P.usrCoords, path2) === 0) {
380                     status = 'entry';
381                     // console.log(P.usrCoords, 'OUT', status);
382                 } else {
383                     status = 'exit';
384                     // console.log(P.usrCoords, 'IN', status);
385                 }
386             // }
387 
388             while (!P._end) {
389                 P = P._next;
390                 if (Type.exists(P.intersect)) {
391                     // console.log("MARKED", status);
392                     P.entry_exit = status;
393 
394                     if (status == 'entry') {
395                         status = 'exit';
396                     } else {
397                         status = 'entry';
398                     }
399                 }
400             }
401         },
402 
403         /**
404          * Tracing phase of the Greiner-Hormann algorithm, see
405          * Greiner, Günther; Kai Hormann (1998).
406          * "Efficient clipping of arbitrary polygons". ACM Transactions on Graphics. 17 (2): 71–83
407          *
408          * Boolean operations on polygons are distinguished: 'intersection', 'union', 'difference'.
409          *
410          * @private
411          * @param  {Array} S           Subject path
412          * @param  {Array} S_intersect Array containing the intersection vertices of the subject path
413          * @param  {String} clip_type  contains the Boolean operation: 'intersection', 'union', or 'difference'
414          * @return {Array}             Array consisting of two arrays containing the x-coordinates and the y-coordintaes of
415          *      the resulting path.
416          */
417         tracing:  function(S, S_intersect, clip_type) {
418             var P, current, start,
419                 cnt = 0,
420                 maxCnt = 40000,
421                 S_idx = 0,
422                 pathX = [],
423                 pathY = [];
424 
425             while (S_idx < S_intersect.length && cnt < maxCnt) {
426                 current = S_intersect[S_idx];
427                 if (current.done) {
428                     S_idx++;
429                     continue;
430                 }
431 
432                 //console.log("Start", current.usrCoords, current.entry_exit, S_idx);
433                 if (pathX.length > 0) {    // Add a new path
434                     pathX.push(NaN);
435                     pathY.push(NaN);
436                 }
437 
438                 start = current.cnt;
439                 P = S;
440                 do {
441                     // Add the "current" intersection vertex
442                     pathX.push(current.usrCoords[1]);
443                     pathY.push(current.usrCoords[2]);
444                     current.done = true;
445 
446                     // console.log(current.pathname, current.cnt, current.entry_exit, current.usrCoords[1].toFixed(3), current.usrCoords[2].toFixed(3));
447                     if ((clip_type == 'intersection' && current.entry_exit == 'entry') ||
448                         (clip_type == 'union' && current.entry_exit == 'exit') ||
449                         (clip_type == 'difference' && (P == S) === (current.entry_exit == 'exit'))
450                         ) {
451                         current = current._next;
452                         do {
453                             cnt++;
454 
455                             pathX.push(current.usrCoords[1]);
456                             pathY.push(current.usrCoords[2]);
457 
458                             if (!Type.exists(current.intersect)) {  // In case there are two adjacent intersects
459                                 current = current._next;
460                             }
461                         } while (!Type.exists(current.intersect) &&
462                                 //  !Type.exists(current.first_point_type) &&
463                                  cnt < maxCnt);
464                     } else {
465                         current = current._prev;
466                         do {
467                             cnt++;
468 
469                             pathX.push(current.usrCoords[1]);
470                             pathY.push(current.usrCoords[2]);
471 
472                             if (!Type.exists(current.intersect)) {  // In case there are two adjacent intersects
473                                 current = current._prev;
474                             }
475                         } while (!Type.exists(current.intersect) &&
476                                 //  !Type.exists(current.first_point_type) &&
477                                  cnt < maxCnt);
478                     }
479                     current.done = true;
480 
481                     if (!current.neighbour) {
482                         console.log("BREAK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!", cnt);
483                         return [[0], [0]];
484                     }
485 
486                     // console.log("Switch", current.pathname, current.cnt, "to", current.neighbour.pathname, current.neighbour.cnt);
487                     current = current.neighbour;
488                     if (current.done) {
489                         pathX.push(current.usrCoords[1]);
490                         pathY.push(current.usrCoords[2]);
491                         break;
492                     }
493                     P = current.path;
494 
495                 } while (!(current.pathname == 'S' && current.cnt == start) && cnt < maxCnt);
496 
497                 S_idx++;
498             }
499 
500             return [pathX, pathY];
501         },
502 
503         /**
504          * Handle path clipping if one of the two paths is empty.
505          * @private
506          * @param  {Array} S        First path, array of JXG.Coords
507          * @param  {Array} C        Second path, array of JXG.Coords
508          * @param  {String} clip_type Type of Boolean operation: 'intersection', 'union', 'differrence'.
509          * @param  {Array} pathX     Array of x-coordinates of the resulting path
510          * @param  {Array} pathY    Array of y-coordinates of the resulting path
511          * @return {Boolean}        true, if one of the input paths is empty, false otherwise.
512          */
513         isEmptyCase: function(S, C, clip_type, pathX, pathY) {
514             var i;
515 
516             if (clip_type === 'intersection' && (S.length === 0 || C.length === 0)) {
517                 return true; //[pathX, pathY];
518             } else if (clip_type === 'union' && (S.length === 0 || C.length === 0)) {
519                 if (S.length == 0) {
520                     for (i = 0; i < C.length; ++i) {
521                         pathX.push(C[i].usrCoords[1]);
522                         pathY.push(C[i].usrCoords[2]);
523                     }
524                 } else {
525                     for (i = 0; i < S.length; ++i) {
526                         pathX.push(S[i].usrCoords[1]);
527                         pathY.push(S[i].usrCoords[2]);
528                     }
529                 }
530                 return true; //[pathX, pathY];
531             } if (clip_type === 'difference' && (S.length === 0 || C.length === 0)) {
532                 if (C.length == 0) {
533                     for (i = 0; i < S.length; ++i) {
534                         pathX.push(S[i].usrCoords[1]);
535                         pathY.push(S[i].usrCoords[2]);
536                     }
537                 }
538                 return true; //[pathX, pathY];
539             }
540 
541             return false;
542         },
543 
544         /**
545          * Handle cases when there are no intersection points of the two paths. This is the case if the
546          * paths are disjoint or one is contained in the other.
547          * @private
548          * @param  {Array} S        First path, array of JXG.Coords
549          * @param  {Array} C        Second path, array of JXG.Coords
550          * @param  {String} clip_type Type of Boolean operation: 'intersection', 'union', 'differrence'.
551          * @return {Array}          Array consisting of two arrays containing the x-coordinates and the y-coordinates of
552          *      the resulting path.
553          */
554         handleEmptyIntersection: function(S, C, clip_type) {
555             var i, P,
556                 pathX = [],
557                 pathY = [];
558 
559             if (clip_type === 'union') {
560                 for (i = 0; i < S.length; ++i) {
561                     pathX.push(S[i].usrCoords[1]);
562                     pathY.push(S[i].usrCoords[2]);
563                 }
564                 pathX.push(NaN);
565                 pathY.push(NaN);
566                 for (i = 0; i < C.length; ++i) {
567                     pathX.push(C[i].usrCoords[1]);
568                     pathY.push(C[i].usrCoords[2]);
569                 }
570                 return [pathX, pathY];
571             }
572 
573             // Test if one curve is contained by the other
574             if (this.windingNumber(S[0].usrCoords, C) === 0) {     // S is outside of C,
575                 if (this.windingNumber(C[0].usrCoords, S) !== 0) { // C is inside of S, i.e. C subset of S
576                     if (clip_type === 'difference') {
577                         for (i = 0; i < S.length; ++i) {
578                             pathX.push(S[i].usrCoords[1]);
579                             pathY.push(S[i].usrCoords[2]);
580                         }
581                         pathX.push(NaN);
582                         pathY.push(NaN);
583                     }
584                     P = C;
585                 } else {                                           // The curves are disjoint
586                     if (clip_type === 'intersection') {
587                         P = [];
588                     } else if (clip_type === 'difference') {
589                         P = S;
590                     }
591                 }
592             } else {                                               // S inside of C, i.e. S subset of C
593                 if (clip_type === 'intersection') {
594                     P = S;
595                 } else if (clip_type === 'difference') {
596                     P = [];
597                 }
598             }
599             for (i = 0; i < P.length; ++i) {
600                 pathX.push(P[i].usrCoords[1]);
601                 pathY.push(P[i].usrCoords[2]);
602             }
603 
604             return [pathX, pathY];
605         },
606 
607         /**
608          * Determine the intersection, union or difference of two closed paths.
609          *
610          * This is an implementation of the Greiner-Hormann algorithm, see
611          * Greiner, Günther; Kai Hormann (1998).
612          * "Efficient clipping of arbitrary polygons". ACM Transactions on Graphics. 17 (2): 71–83.
613          *
614          * @param  {JXG.Circle|JXG.Curve|JXG.Polygon} subject   First closed path, usually called 'subject'.
615          * @param  {JXG.Circle|JXG.Curve|JXG.Polygon} clip      Second closed path, usually called 'clip'.
616          * @param  {String} clip_type Determines the type of boolean operation on the two paths.
617          *  Possible values are 'intersection', 'union', or 'difference'.
618          * @param  {JXG.Board} board   JSXGraph board object. It is needed to convert between
619          * user coordinates and screen coordinates.
620          * @return {Array}          Array consisting of two arrays containing the x-coordinates and the y-coordinates of
621          *      the resulting path.
622          *
623          * @see JXG.Math.Clip#intersection
624          * @see JXG.Math.Clip#union
625          * @see JXG.Math.Clip#difference
626          *
627          * @example
628          *     var curve1 = board.create('curve', [
629          *             [-3, 3, 0, -3],
630          *             [3, 3, 0, 3]
631          *         ],
632          *         {strokeColor: 'black'});
633          *
634          *     var curve2 = board.create('curve', [
635          *             [-4, 4, 0, -4],
636          *             [2, 2, 4, 2]
637          *         ],
638          *         {strokeColor: 'blue'});
639          *
640          *     var clip_path = board.create('curve', [[], []], {strokeWidth: 3, fillColor: 'yellow', fillOpacity: 0.6});
641          *     clip_path.updateDataArray = function() {
642          *         var a = JXG.Math.Clip.greinerHormann(curve2, curve1, 'intersection', this.board);
643          *
644          *         this.dataX = a[0];
645          *         this.dataY = a[1];
646          *     };
647          *
648          *     board.update();
649          *
650          * </pre><div id="JXG9d2a6acf-a43b-4035-8f8a-9b1bee580210" class="jxgbox" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
651          * <script type="text/javascript">
652          *     (function() {
653          *         var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXG9d2a6acf-a43b-4035-8f8a-9b1bee580210',
654          *             {boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8,-8], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
655          *
656          *         var curve1 = board.create('curve', [
657          *                 [-3, 3, 0, -3],
658          *                 [3, 3, 0, 3]
659          *             ],
660          *             {strokeColor: 'black'});
661          *
662          *         var curve2 = board.create('curve', [
663          *                 [-4, 4, 0, -4],
664          *                 [2, 2, 4, 2]
665          *             ],
666          *             {strokeColor: 'blue'});
667          *
668          *         var clip_path = board.create('curve', [[], []], {strokeWidth: 3, fillColor: 'yellow', fillOpacity: 0.6});
669          *         clip_path.updateDataArray = function() {
670          *             var a = JXG.Math.Clip.greinerHormann(curve2, curve1, 'intersection', this.board);
671          *
672          *             this.dataX = a[0];
673          *             this.dataY = a[1];
674          *         };
675          *
676          *         board.update();
677          *
678          *     })();
679          *
680          * </script><pre>
681          *
682          * @example
683          *     var curve1 = board.create('curve', [
684          *             [-3, 3, 0, -3],
685          *             [3, 3, 0, 3]
686          *         ],
687          *         {strokeColor: 'black', fillColor: 'none', fillOpacity: 0.8});
688          *
689          *     var curve2 = board.create('polygon', [[3, 4], [-4, 0], [-4, 4]],
690          *             {strokeColor: 'blue', fillColor: 'none'});
691          *
692          *     var clip_path = board.create('curve', [[], []], {strokeWidth: 3, fillColor: 'yellow', fillOpacity: 0.6});
693          *     clip_path.updateDataArray = function() {
694          *         var a = JXG.Math.Clip.greinerHormann(curve1, curve2, 'union', this.board);
695          *         this.dataX = a[0];
696          *         this.dataY = a[1];
697          *     };
698          *
699          *     board.update();
700          *
701          * </pre><div id="JXG6075c918-4d57-4b72-b600-6597a6a4f44e" class="jxgbox" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
702          * <script type="text/javascript">
703          *     (function() {
704          *         var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXG6075c918-4d57-4b72-b600-6597a6a4f44e',
705          *             {boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8,-8], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
706          *         var curve1 = board.create('curve', [
707          *                 [-3, 3, 0, -3],
708          *                 [3, 3, 0, 3]
709          *             ],
710          *             {strokeColor: 'black', fillColor: 'none', fillOpacity: 0.8});
711          *
712          *         var curve2 = board.create('polygon', [[3, 4], [-4, 0], [-4, 4]],
713          *                 {strokeColor: 'blue', fillColor: 'none'});

715          *
716          *         var clip_path = board.create('curve', [[], []], {strokeWidth: 3, fillColor: 'yellow', fillOpacity: 0.6});
717          *         clip_path.updateDataArray = function() {
718          *             var a = JXG.Math.Clip.greinerHormann(curve1, curve2, 'union', this.board);
719          *             this.dataX = a[0];
720          *             this.dataY = a[1];
721          *         };
722          *
723          *         board.update();
724          *
725          *     })();
726          *
727          * </script><pre>
728          *
729          * @example
730          *     var curve1 = board.create('curve', [
731          *             [-4, 4, 0, -4],
732          *             [4, 4, -2, 4]
733          *         ],
734          *         {strokeColor: 'black', fillColor: 'none', fillOpacity: 0.8});
735          *
736          *     var curve2 = board.create('circle', [[0, 0], [0, -2]],
737          *             {strokeColor: 'blue', strokeWidth: 1, fillColor: 'red', fixed: true, fillOpacity: 0.3,
738          *             center: {visible: true, size: 5}, point2: {size: 5}});
739          *
740          *     var clip_path = board.create('curve', [[], []], {strokeWidth: 3, fillColor: 'yellow', fillOpacity: 0.6});
741          *     clip_path.updateDataArray = function() {
742          *         var a = JXG.Math.Clip.greinerHormann(curve1, curve2, 'difference', this.board);
743          *
744          *         this.dataX = a[0];
745          *         this.dataY = a[1];
746          *     };
747          *
748          *     board.update();
749          *
750          * </pre><div id="JXG46b3316b-5ab9-4928-9473-ccb476ca4185" class="jxgbox" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
751          * <script type="text/javascript">
752          *     (function() {
753          *         var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXG46b3316b-5ab9-4928-9473-ccb476ca4185',
754          *             {boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8,-8], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
755          *         var curve1 = board.create('curve', [
756          *                 [-4, 4, 0, -4],
757          *                 [4, 4, -2, 4]
758          *             ],
759          *             {strokeColor: 'black', fillColor: 'none', fillOpacity: 0.8});
760          *
761          *         var curve2 = board.create('circle', [[0, 0], [0, -2]],
762          *                 {strokeColor: 'blue', strokeWidth: 1, fillColor: 'red', fixed: true, fillOpacity: 0.3,
763          *                 center: {visible: true, size: 5}, point2: {size: 5}});
764          *
765          *
766          *         var clip_path = board.create('curve', [[], []], {strokeWidth: 3, fillColor: 'yellow', fillOpacity: 0.6});
767          *         clip_path.updateDataArray = function() {
768          *             var a = JXG.Math.Clip.greinerHormann(curve1, curve2, 'difference', this.board);
769          *
770          *             this.dataX = a[0];
771          *             this.dataY = a[1];
772          *         };
773          *
774          *         board.update();
775          *
776          *     })();
777          *
778          * </script><pre>
779          *
780          */
781         greinerHormann: function(subject, clip, clip_type, board) { //},
782                 // subject_first_point_type, clip_first_point_type) {
783 
784             var i, r, rad,
785                 steps = 359,
786                 S = [],
787                 C = [],
788                 S_intersect = [],
789                 C_intersect = [],
790                 res = [],
791                 pathX = [],
792                 pathY = [];
793 
794             // Collect all points into subject array S
795             if (subject.elementClass == Const.OBJECT_CLASS_CURVE && Type.exists(subject.points)) {
796                     S = subject.points;
797             } else if (subject.type == Const.OBJECT_TYPE_POLYGON) {
798                 for (i = 0; i < subject.vertices.length; i++) {
799                     S.push(new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, subject.vertices[i].coords.usrCoords, board));
800                 }
801             } else if (subject.elementClass == Const.OBJECT_CLASS_CIRCLE) {
802                 r = subject.Radius();
803                 rad = 2 * Math.PI / steps;
804                 for (i = 0; i <= steps; i++) {
805                     S.push(new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [
806                             subject.center.coords.usrCoords[0],
807                             subject.center.coords.usrCoords[1] + Math.cos(i * rad) * r,
808                             subject.center.coords.usrCoords[2] + Math.sin(i * rad) * r
809                         ], board));
810                 }
811             }
812 
813             // Collect all points into client array C
814             if (clip.elementClass == Const.OBJECT_CLASS_CURVE &&
815                 Type.exists(clip.points)) {
816                     C = clip.points;
817             } else if (clip.type == Const.OBJECT_TYPE_POLYGON) {
818                 for (i = 0; i < clip.vertices.length; i++) {
819                     C.push(new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, clip.vertices[i].coords.usrCoords, board));
820                 }
821             } else if (clip.elementClass == Const.OBJECT_CLASS_CIRCLE) {
822                 r = clip.Radius();
823                 rad = 2 * Math.PI / steps;
824                 for (i = 0; i <= steps; i++) {
825                     C.push(new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [
826                             clip.center.coords.usrCoords[0],
827                             clip.center.coords.usrCoords[1] + Math.cos(i * rad) * r,
828                             clip.center.coords.usrCoords[2] + Math.sin(i * rad) * r
829                         ], board));
830                 }
831             }
832 
833             // Handle cases where at least one of the paths is empty
834             if (this.isEmptyCase(S, C, clip_type, pathX, pathY)) {
835                 return [pathX, pathY];
836             }
837 
838             // Add pointers for doubly linked lists
839             this.doublyLinkedList(S);
840             this.doublyLinkedList(C);
841 
842             res = this.findIntersections(S, C, board);
843             S_intersect = res[0];
844             C_intersect = res[1];
845 
846             // For non-closed paths
847             // if (true && typeof subject_first_point_type === 'string') {
848             //     S[0].neighbour = C[C.length - 1];
849             //     S[0].first_point_type = subject_first_point_type;
850             //     S[S.length - 1].neighbour = C[0];
851             //     S[S.length - 1].first_point_type = subject_first_point_type;
852             // }
853             // if (true && typeof clip_first_point_type === 'string') {
854             //     C[0].neighbour = S[S.length - 1];
855             //     C[0].first_point_type = clip_first_point_type;
856             //     C[C.length - 1].neighbour = S[0];
857             //     C[C.length - 1].first_point_type = clip_first_point_type;
858             // }
859 
860             // Handle cases without intersections
861             if (S_intersect.length === 0) {
862                 return this.handleEmptyIntersection(S, C, clip_type);
863             }
864 
865             // Phase 2: mark intersection points as entry or exit points
866             this.markEntryExit(S, C); //, subject_first_point_type);
867             if (S[0].distance(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, C[0]) === 0) {
868                 // Randomly disturb the first point of the second path
869                 // if both paths start at the same point.
870                 C[0].usrCoords[1] *= 1 + Math.random() * 0.0001 - 0.00005;
871                 C[0].usrCoords[2] *= 1 + Math.random() * 0.0001 - 0.00005;
872             }
873             this.markEntryExit(C, S); //, clip_first_point_type);
874 
875             if (false) {
876                 for (i = 0; i < S_intersect.length; i++) {
877                     console.log('S', S_intersect[i].cnt, S_intersect[i].entry_exit, S_intersect[i].usrCoords,
878                             S_intersect[i].pos, S_intersect[i].alpha);
879                 }
880                 console.log();
881                 for (i = 0; i < C_intersect.length; i++) {
882                     console.log('C', C_intersect[i].cnt, C_intersect[i].entry_exit, C_intersect[i].usrCoords,
883                             C_intersect[i].pos, C_intersect[i].alpha);
884                 }
885             }
886             // Phase 3: tracing
887             return this.tracing(S, S_intersect, clip_type);
888 
889         },
890 
891         /**
892          * Union of two closed paths. The paths could be JSXGraph elements circle, curve, or polygon.
893          * Computed by the Greiner-Hormann algorithm.
894          *
895          * @param  {JXG.Circle|JXG.Curve|JXG.Polygon} subject   First closed path.
896          * @param  {JXG.Circle|JXG.Curve|JXG.Polygon} clip      Second closed path.
897          * @param  {JXG.Board} board   JSXGraph board object. It is needed to convert between
898          * user coordinates and screen coordinates.
899          * @return {Array}          Array consisting of two arrays containing the x-coordinates and the y-coordinates of
900          *      the resulting path.
901          *
902          * @see JXG.Math.Clip#greinerHormann
903          * @see JXG.Math.Clip#intersection
904          * @see JXG.Math.Clip#difference
905          *
906          * @example
907          *     var curve1 = board.create('curve', [
908          *             [-3, 3, 0, -3],
909          *             [3, 3, 0, 3]
910          *         ],
911          *         {strokeColor: 'black'});
912          *
913          *     var curve2 = board.create('polygon', [[3, 4], [-4, 0], [-4, 4]],
914          *             {strokeColor: 'blue', fillColor: 'none'});
915          *
916          *     var clip_path = board.create('curve', [[], []], {strokeWidth: 3, fillColor: 'yellow', fillOpacity: 0.3});
917          *     clip_path.updateDataArray = function() {
918          *         var a = JXG.Math.Clip.union(curve1, curve2, this.board);
919          *         this.dataX = a[0];
920          *         this.dataY = a[1];
921          *     };
922          *
923          *     board.update();
924          *
925          * </pre><div id="JXG7c5204aa-3824-4464-819c-80df7bf1d917" class="jxgbox" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
926          * <script type="text/javascript">
927          *     (function() {
928          *         var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXG7c5204aa-3824-4464-819c-80df7bf1d917',
929          *             {boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8,-8], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
930          *         var curve1 = board.create('curve', [
931          *                 [-3, 3, 0, -3],
932          *                 [3, 3, 0, 3]
933          *             ],
934          *             {strokeColor: 'black'});
935          *
936          *         var curve2 = board.create('polygon', [[3, 4], [-4, 0], [-4, 4]],
937          *                 {strokeColor: 'blue', fillColor: 'none'});
938          *
939          *
940          *         var clip_path = board.create('curve', [[], []], {strokeWidth: 3, fillColor: 'yellow', fillOpacity: 0.3});
941          *         clip_path.updateDataArray = function() {
942          *             var a = JXG.Math.Clip.union(curve1, curve2, this.board);
943          *             this.dataX = a[0];
944          *             this.dataY = a[1];
945          *         };
946          *
947          *         board.update();
948          *
949          *     })();
950          *
951          * </script><pre>
952          *
953          */
954         union: function(path1, path2, board) {
955             return this.greinerHormann(path1, path2, 'union', board);
956         },
957 
958         /**
959          * Intersection of two closed paths. The paths could be JSXGraph elements circle, curve, or polygon.
960          * Computed by the Greiner-Hormann algorithm.
961          *
962          * @param  {JXG.Circle|JXG.Curve|JXG.Polygon} subject   First closed path.
963          * @param  {JXG.Circle|JXG.Curve|JXG.Polygon} clip      Second closed path.
964          * @param  {JXG.Board} board   JSXGraph board object. It is needed to convert between
965          * user coordinates and screen coordinates.
966          * @return {Array}          Array consisting of two arrays containing the x-coordinates and the y-coordinates of
967          *      the resulting path.
968          *
969          * @see JXG.Math.Clip#greinerHormann
970          * @see JXG.Math.Clip#union
971          * @see JXG.Math.Clip#difference
972          *
973          * @example
974          * var p = [];
975          * p.push(board.create('point', [0, -5]));
976          * p.push(board.create('point', [-5, 0]));
977          * p.push(board.create('point', [-3, 3]));
978          *
979          * var curve1 = board.create('ellipse', p,
980          *                 {strokeColor: 'black'});
981          *
982          * var curve2 = board.create('curve', [function(phi){return 4 * Math.cos(2*phi); },
983          *                                     [0, 0],
984          *                                     0, 2 * Math.PI],
985          *                       {curveType:'polar', strokeColor: 'blue', strokewidth:1});
986          *
987          * var clip_path = board.create('curve', [[], []], {strokeWidth: 3, fillColor: 'yellow', fillOpacity: 0.3});
988          * clip_path.updateDataArray = function() {
989          *     var a = JXG.Math.Clip.intersection(curve2, curve1, this.board);
990          *
991          *     this.dataX = a[0];
992          *     this.dataY = a[1];
993          * };
994          *
995          * board.update();
996          *
997          * </pre><div id="JXG7ad547eb-7b6c-4a1a-a4d4-4ed298fc7998" class="jxgbox" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
998          * <script type="text/javascript">
999          *     (function() {
1000          *         var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXG7ad547eb-7b6c-4a1a-a4d4-4ed298fc7998',
1001          *             {boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8,-8], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
1002          *     var p = [];
1003          *     p.push(board.create('point', [0, -5]));
1004          *     p.push(board.create('point', [-5, 0]));
1005          *     p.push(board.create('point', [-3, 3]));
1006          *
1007          *     var curve1 = board.create('ellipse', p,
1008          *                     {strokeColor: 'black'});
1009          *
1010          *     var curve2 = board.create('curve', [function(phi){return 4 * Math.cos(2*phi); },
1011          *                                         [0, 0],
1012          *                                         0, 2 * Math.PI],
1013          *                           {curveType:'polar', strokeColor: 'blue', strokewidth:1});
1014          *
1015          *
1016          *     var clip_path = board.create('curve', [[], []], {strokeWidth: 3, fillColor: 'yellow', fillOpacity: 0.3});
1017          *     clip_path.updateDataArray = function() {
1018          *         var a = JXG.Math.Clip.intersection(curve2, curve1, this.board);
1019          *
1020          *         this.dataX = a[0];
1021          *         this.dataY = a[1];
1022          *     };
1023          *
1024          *     board.update();
1025          *
1026          *     })();
1027          *
1028          * </script><pre>
1029          *
1030          *
1031          */
1032         intersection: function(path1, path2, board) {
1033             return this.greinerHormann(path1, path2, 'intersection', board);
1034         },
1035 
1036         /**
1037          * Difference of two closed paths, i.e. path1 minus path2.
1038          * The paths could be JSXGraph elements circle, curve, or polygon.
1039          * Computed by the Greiner-Hormann algorithm.
1040          *
1041          * @param  {JXG.Circle|JXG.Curve|JXG.Polygon} subject   First closed path.
1042          * @param  {JXG.Circle|JXG.Curve|JXG.Polygon} clip      Second closed path.
1043          * @param  {JXG.Board} board   JSXGraph board object. It is needed to convert between
1044          * user coordinates and screen coordinates.
1045          * @return {Array}          Array consisting of two arrays containing the x-coordinates and the y-coordinates of
1046          *      the resulting path.
1047          *
1048          * @see JXG.Math.Clip#greinerHormann
1049          * @see JXG.Math.Clip#intersection
1050          * @see JXG.Math.Clip#union
1051          *
1052          * @example
1053          *     var curve1 = board.create('polygon', [[-4, 4], [4, 4], [0, -1]],
1054          *             {strokeColor: 'blue', fillColor: 'none'});
1055          *
1056          *     var curve2 = board.create('curve', [
1057          *             [-1, 1, 0, -1],
1058          *             [1, 1, 3, 1]
1059          *         ],
1060          *         {strokeColor: 'black', fillColor: 'none', fillOpacity: 0.8});
1061          *
1062          *     var clip_path = board.create('curve', [[], []], {strokeWidth: 3, fillColor: 'yellow', fillOpacity: 0.3});
1063          *     clip_path.updateDataArray = function() {
1064          *         var a = JXG.Math.Clip.difference(curve1, curve2, this.board);
1065          *         this.dataX = a[0];
1066          *         this.dataY = a[1];
1067          *     };
1068          *
1069          *     board.update();
1070          *
1071          * </pre><div id="JXGc5ce6bb3-146c-457f-a48b-6b9081fb68a3" class="jxgbox" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
1072          * <script type="text/javascript">
1073          *     (function() {
1074          *         var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('JXGc5ce6bb3-146c-457f-a48b-6b9081fb68a3',
1075          *             {boundingbox: [-8, 8, 8,-8], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
1076          *         var curve1 = board.create('polygon', [[-4, 4], [4, 4], [0, -1]],
1077          *                 {strokeColor: 'blue', fillColor: 'none'});
1078          *
1079          *         var curve2 = board.create('curve', [
1080          *                 [-1, 1, 0, -1],
1081          *                 [1, 1, 3, 1]
1082          *             ],
1083          *             {strokeColor: 'black', fillColor: 'none', fillOpacity: 0.8});
1084          *
1085          *
1086          *         var clip_path = board.create('curve', [[], []], {strokeWidth: 3, fillColor: 'yellow', fillOpacity: 0.3});
1087          *         clip_path.updateDataArray = function() {
1088          *             var a = JXG.Math.Clip.difference(curve1, curve2, this.board);
1089          *             this.dataX = a[0];
1090          *             this.dataY = a[1];
1091          *         };
1092          *
1093          *         board.update();
1094          *
1095          *     })();
1096          *
1097          * </script><pre>
1098          *
1099          */
1100         difference: function(path1, path2, board) {
1101             return this.greinerHormann(path1, path2, 'difference', board);
1102         }
1103     };
1104 
1105     JXG.extend(Mat.Clip, /** @lends JXG.Math.Clip */ {
1106     });
1107 
1108     return Mat.Clip;
1109 });
1110
